meanings.definition: Shocked or amazed by a sudden loud noise, like thunder.
meanings.sent1: The children were thunderstricken by the loud thunder during the storm.
meanings.sent2: She felt thunderstricken when the thunder roared unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked thunderstricken when it heard the thunder for the first time.
meanings.sent4: His face was thunderstricken as the thunder rumbled in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstricken expression on her face showed her shock at the loud noise.

meanings.definition: Affected or overwhelmed by a sudden and powerful event or experience.
meanings.sent1: The town was thunderstricken by the sudden news of the flood.
meanings.sent2: He was thunderstricken by the unexpected turn of events.
meanings.sent3: The dog's thunderstricken reaction to the vacuum cleaner was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The team was thunderstricken by their victory against the champions.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstricken crowd cheered wildly at the thrilling performance.
